#summary Embedding trace viewer

Embedding trace-viewer as your own component is relatively easy.

Source the trace-viewer javascript. The development way to do this is:
{{{
<script src="base.js"></script>
<script>base.require('trace-viewer');</script>
}}}

To get a flattened form:
{{{
/build/generate_standalone_timeline_view.py --js=trace_viewer.js --css=trace_viewer.css
}}}

Then bring those in:
{{{
<link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="trace_viewer.css">
<script src="trace_viewer.js"></script>
}}}

Once its loaded, !TimelineView and Model are your friends:
{{{
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
  var model = Model();
  model.importTraces([... do an xhr to get the data...]);

  var viewEl = tracing.TimelineView();
  viewEl.model = model;
  document.body.appendChild(viewEl);
});
}}}

Take a peek at [http://code.google.com/p/trace-viewer/source/browse/trunk/examples/trace_viewer.html trace_viewer.html] for an example of this in action.
